name: Managed Democracy
ability: Each day, if there are 5 or more players still alive and no one dies from execution, then a player who was nominated today will be arbitrarily executed. [Loric]
flavor: Managed Democracy offers true Freedom: Freedom from the burden of choice.

name: Warfront
ability: Demons are accompanied by at least one Minion of the same Front.
flavor: A three-front conflict, just like the First Galactic War. When will these aliens learn?

name: Friendly Fire
ability: Once per game, when a player dies, their aligned neighbor will die too. [Loric]
flavor: Remember, kids: Friendly Fire isn't.

otherNightReminder: WIP
name: The Algorithm
ability: Each night, choose a non-traveller character: The next day, before nominations for execution occur, a special nomination cycle will be held to choose a non-traveller player. A good player, if elected, becomes the chosen character at dusk.
flavor: I heard that some dissidents wanted us to select our own candidates instead of using the algorithm. Great idea. Everyone'll just become a political expert overnight. Treasonous morons.

name: Hellbomb
ability: Once per day, you may choose to kill both your alive neighbors, if at least one alive neighbor agrees.
flavor: Down Up Left Down Up Right Down Up

otherNightReminder: Choose a player :reminder:
name: Beacon
ability: Each night, choose a player. If you nominate an evil player during the next day, then the folloing night your previously chosen player learns that they are evil.

otherNightReminder: Give a finger signal.
name: Democracy Officer
ability: Each night*, learn the number of players who, during the previous days nominations, were your alive neighbor, were evil, and voted.
flavor: Our citizens depend on you for their safety.

otherNightReminder: Give a finger signal.
name: Free-of-Thought
ability: Each night, you learn how many characters attempted to change your role or alignment. Also, even when dead, you cannot be affected by madness and your character and alignment cannot be changed.
flavor: Nobody’s going to control your mind, soldier.

otherNightReminder: On the Freedom Youth's third night :Reminder: have them choose a character.
name: Freedom Youth
ability: On your third night, you may choose a new character to become. The Storyteller may prompt you to choose differently.
flavor: The children, in an inspiring act of patriotic gratitude, have all signed MOD Form 11 "Intent to Enlist.". Once grown, they will join the ranks of SEAF and carry the torch of heroic valor that saved their lives.

name: Genetecist
ability: You start knowing how many characters that can cause character change are in-play.

name: Helldiver
ability: Once per game, during the day before nominations, publicly choose a player. If one of you votes less than the other today, they die at night.
flavor: Prove to yourself that you have the strength, and the courage, to be Free.

name: High Command
ability: Each night, choose a player: if the chosen player is executed and all good players voted to execute them, then the Demon doesn't wake tonight.
flavor: High Command offers this guidance in order to conserve Helldivers' critical decision-making effort, for use on the battlefield itself.

firstNightReminder: The Interrogator might use their ability. :reminder:
otherNightReminder: The Interrogator might use their ability. :reminder: If they used their ability, show the Interrogator the Character token of the Target.
name: Interrogator
ability: Once per game, at night, choose a player: if you are “mad” that they are evil during the next day, then learn their character that night. Otherwise, learn nothing.
flavor: The Ministry of Truth is responsible for keeping all citizens well-informed and mentally equipped to withstand our enemies' vile propaganda.

firstNightReminder: The Martyr chooses a different player than last night. :reminder: If that player would die, wake the Martyr and show them the "This Character chose you" and their Martyr token.
otherNightReminder: The Martyr chooses a different player than last night. :reminder: If that player would die, wake the Martyr and show them the "This Character chose you" and their Martyr token.
name: Martyr
ability: Each night, choose a player. If they would die tonight, then you die instead.
flavor: Super Earth will never forget the Helldivers we lost today, nor the incremental gains their sacrifice achieved.

otherNightReminder: The Re-Educator chooses a player. Put the Re-Educator to sleep. If the Re-Educator chose a Good Outsider, then wake them. Show the *THIS CHARACTER SELECTED YOU* card and the Re-Educator token. Show the *YOU ARE* card and their new Townsfolk token. If the Re-Educator chose an evil player, the Re-Educator might die. :reminder:
name: Re-Educator
ability: Each night*, choose a player: A chosen good Outsider becomes a not-in-play Townsfolk at dawn. If the chosen player is evil, you might die. [+1 Outsider]
flavor: Don't worry, if you fail an objective, you will NOT be sent to a freedom camp. This is merely a dissident rumor.

otherNightReminder: Give a finger signal.
name: Researcher
ability: Each night, you learn how many players changed characters this night.
flavor: I've heard there's some kind of secret superweapon being worked on by our top scientists. Not the ones who made the Termicide, of course. They're all being interrogated for treason. Our other top scientists.

firstNightReminder: Wake the player. Show them the *THESE CHARACTERS ARE NOT IN PLAY* card, and all Evil Characters associated with the not-in-play Front. If all fronts are in play, show them a thumbs down.
name: Ship Master
ability: You start knowing a not-in-play Front. (Or that all Fronts are in play).

firstNightReminder: The Truth Enforcer may choose a player. :reminder: Wake the chosen player and show them the *THIS CHARACTER SELECTED YOU* token and the Truth Enforcer token.
otherNightReminder: The Truth Enforcer may choose a player. :reminder: Wake the chosen player and show them the *THIS CHARACTER SELECTED YOU* token and the Truth Enforcer token.
name: Truth Enforcer
ability: Each night, you may choose a player, and they learn they have been chosen. If a good player is chosen, then the next day they are “mad” that they are their character, or they might be executed.
flavor: If there's one thing we love here on Super Earth, it's the truth. We’ve even got a whole Ministry dedicated to the creation, fine-tuning, and wide distribution of it.

firstNightReminder: If the Demon chose either of the Cyborg's neighors tonight, then wake the Cyborg and show them the *YOU ARE* card, and the Evil handsign. If the Cyborg dies, wake the Cyborg and show the *YOU ARE* card, and the Good handsign.
otherNightReminder: If the Demon chose either of the Cyborg's neighors tonight, then wake the Cyborg and show them the *YOU ARE* card, and the Evil handsign. If the Cyborg dies, wake the Cyborg and show the *YOU ARE* card, and the Good handsign.
name: Cyborg
ability: When your neighbor is chosen by a Demon, you join the Demon's team until you die. You learn when this happens.
flavor: In the First Galactic War, we cast the Illuminate from our galaxy, and secured the half-human Cyborgs safely in the mines of Cyberstan.

name: Dissident
ability: You might register as evil while voting. If a good player publicly speculates about you being a Dissident, you might be executed.
flavor: I earned a few more Citizenship points the other day. All it took was reportin' some unpatriotic talk I heard in the barracks. Now there's one less dissident, and I get one more doctor's visit every year.

otherNightReminder: If there are three or more Voteless alive, mark an arbitrary number of them for death. :reminder:
name: Voteless
ability: You may only vote once per day. If you vote more than once, you might die at night. If only three or less non-Voteless characters remain alive, you die at dawn.
flavor: They have been stripped of something even deeper than their humanity: their capacity to participate in the Democratic process.

name: Collateral
ability: When either of your Alive neighbors are executed, you might die during the night.
flavor: Their lives were in our hands.

firstNightReminder: The Bile Spewer chooses a player. :reminder:
otherNightReminder: The Bile Spewer chooses a player. :reminder: If this is the second time a player is picked, wake them and show the *THIS CHARACTER PICKED YOU* card and the Bile Spewer token.
name: Bile Spewer
ability: Each night, choose a player: The first time, they are poisoned until dusk. The second time, they are poisoned until dusk and learn they were chosen. The third time, they die. A player’s count is reset when they die. [Terminid Front]
flavor: The Bile Spewer’s thorax is bloated with several metric tons of corrosive acid, which it vomits in revulsion upon encountering Democracy.

otherNightReminder: The Gloom chooses a player. :reminder:
name: Gloom
ability: Each night, choose a player: They might register as evil & as a Minion or Demon, until dusk. [Terminid Front]
flavor: The Gloom has altered the very air of the worlds caught in its haze. Once-familiar worlds are now foreign lands, nesting grounds for skittering new monstrosities.

otherNightReminder: Point to a player.
name: Detector
ability: Each night*, learn a player who the Storyteller believes you should watch carefully. [Automaton Front]
flavor: What Automatons we have faced thus far were but a component of their grand apparatus.

otherNightReminder: The Jammer chooses a player. :reminder:
name: Jammer
ability: Each night, choose a player: If they nominate the next day, it fails even if it receives enough votes. All players learn when a vote fails due to this ability. This ability only works when there are 5 or more players alive. [Automaton Front]
flavor: The Automatons have proved a greater threat to Democracy than anticipated.

otherNightReminder: If a Good Outsider was executed yesterday, resurrect the Fleshmob.
name: Fleshmob
ability: You might register as an Outsider and a Voteless. If you are dead and town executes a good Outsider, you can choose to ressurect during that night. [Illuminate Front]
flavor: It seems the Illuminate wish to transform our citizens' minds and bodies. But are these monstrosities the end of their gruesome experimentation... or merely the beginning?

firstNightReminder: Give a finger signal. Wake the Demon and show the *THIS CHARACTER CHOSE YOU* card, the Overseer token, and a finger signal.
otherNightReminder: Give a finger signal. Wake the Demon and show the *THIS CHARACTER CHOSE YOU* card, the Overseer token, and a finger signal.
name: Overseer
ability: Each night, learn how many Outsiders are alive. [+1 Outsider. Illuminate Front]
flavor: They bend the Voteless to their will, using them as expendable shields in a craven attempt to conserve their own numbers.

otherNightReminder: The Bile Titan chooses a player. :reminder: :reminder: :reminder:
name: Bile Titan
ability: Each night*, choose two players: one dies, and one is poisoned until dusk. [Terminid Front]
flavor: The ravenous Terminids are guided solely by an instinctive urge to reproduce, spread, and destroy Democracy.

firstNightReminder: Show the Predator the *YOU ARE* card, the Predator token, and their Townsfolk ability token.
otherNightReminder: The Predator chooses a player. :reminder:
name: Predator
ability: Each night, choose a player. Learn who they choose tonight, if anyone. A previously chosen player dies when a different player is chosen. [Terminid Front]
flavor: A Gloom-enhanced strain of Terminids has been reported on this planet. SEAF patrols have been lured into ambushes, and picked off by unseen assailants.

otherNightReminder: The Fabricator chooses a player. :reminder: Wake the Minion, show them the *THIS CHARACTER SELECTED YOU* card and the Fabricator token. Show them the *USE YOUR ABILITY?* card. They may choose a different Minion of the same Front.
name: Fabricator
ability: Each night*, choose a player: A chosen non-Minion dies. A chosen Minon may choose to become a different Minion of their current Front. [Automaton Front]
flavor: Is there some yet-concealed architect of the Automatons? Or did they emerge of their own accord, from the primordial ooze of machine logic and binary code?

otherNightReminder: The Illusionist chooses a player. Put the Illusionist to sleep. Wake the chosen player. Ressurect them. :reminder: Show them the *YOU ARE* card, and the Voteless token.
name: Illusionist
ability: Each night*, choose a player: they become an alive Voteless. A chosen Minion will poison a Townsfolk neighbor if they are executed. [Illuminate Front]
flavor: What the Illuminate are planning, none can say.
